snippet: After part of the law was ruled unconstitutional, state officials are grappling with proposals that could significantly change how criminals are sentenced to die.
abstract: Florida's State Legislature and courts are dealing with impact of Supreme Court ruling striking down part of state's capital punishment statute; fate is uncertain for 390 inmates on death row as prosecutions in death penalty cases stall and lawmakers scramble to formulate and pass new statute before current legislative session ends in six weeks.
lead_paragraph: After part of the law was ruled unconstitutional, state officials are grappling with proposals that could significantly change how criminals are sentenced to die.

headline.main: Supreme Court Ruling Has Florida Scrambling to Fix Death Penalty Law
headline.print_headline: After a Supreme Court Ruling, Florida Scrambles to Revise Death Sentencing
